title: Matchstick Pattern
core_prompt: A pattern uses 3 sticks for the first triangle, then adds 2 sticks each new triangle in a row. How many sticks for 8 triangles?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: Write a rule for n triangles.

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: How many triangles can you build with 101 sticks?

hint_ladder: Look at how much changes each step.
solution_steps: First term 3, difference 2.

title: Handshakes Lite
core_prompt: In a club of 6 students, each pair shakes hands once. How many handshakes total?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: What if there are 10 students?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Give a formula for n students.

solution_steps: Count pairs among 6 people.

title: Truth Tokens
core_prompt: Three boxes are labeled Apples, Oranges, Mixed. All labels are wrong. You may pick one fruit from one box. How do you relabel all boxes?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: Explain why one draw is enough.
extensions.answer: Because every label is wrong and one true identity locks others.

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Generalize to 4 boxes with all-wrong labels.

hint_ladder: Choose the box giving most information.
The Mixed label cannot be mixed.
solution_steps: Mixed-labeled box must contain only one fruit type.
After identifying it, remaining two labels are forced.

title: Rectangle Cut
core_prompt: Can a 6×6 square be cut into two pieces and rearranged into a 9×4 rectangle without stretching?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: What must stay the same under rearrangement?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Give another pair of dimensions with same area 36.

hint_ladder: Reveal: both have area 36 so possible in principle.
solution_steps: 6×6 area is 36.
9×4 area is 36, so area allows rearrangement.

title: Take 1 or 2
core_prompt: There are 15 stones. Players alternate taking 1 or 2 stones. Taking last stone wins. Should first player go first to win?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: What starting counts are losing positions?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: What if players can take 1,2,or 3?

hint_ladder: Reveal: multiples of 3 are losing when moves are 1 or 2.
solution_steps: Losing positions: 3,6,9,12,15 if your turn starts there.
From 15, first player takes 1 to give 14 and can force win by making total taken each pair =3.

title: Grid Paths
core_prompt: How many shortest paths from A to B on a 3×3 grid moving only right/up?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: What about a 4×4 grid?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Rule for N×N?

hint_ladder: Reveal: choose rights among total moves.
solution_steps: Need 3 rights and 3 ups, total 6 moves.
Count sequences: C(6,3)=20.

title: Always/Sometimes/Never
core_prompt: Is n^2 - n always even for integer n?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: Classify n^2+n similarly.

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Classify n^2+1 parity.

hint_ladder: Reveal: n(n-1) has an even factor.
solution_steps: Consecutive numbers include an even one, so product is even.

title: Mystery Weights
core_prompt: Two stars and one moon weigh 19. One star and two moons weigh 17. What is star - moon?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: Find each weight.

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: If totals become 31 and 29, what changes?

hint_ladder: Name star = s and moon = m.
solution_steps: Subtract second equation from first: s-m=2.
So difference is 2.

title: Folded Corners
core_prompt: A square paper has side 8. Fold one corner to the center. What is the crease length from side to side?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: Approximate numerically.

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Generalize for side s.

hint_ladder: Reveal: find intercept distance using geometry.
solution_steps: Segment from corner to center has midpoint (2,2).
Perpendicular bisector intersects sides to create length 4√2.

title: Digit Sums
core_prompt: How many 2-digit numbers have digits summing to 10?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: How many 3-digit numbers sum to 10?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: General stars-and-bars approach?

solution_steps: Tens digit from 1 to 9 gives nine options.
Each determines ones digit to total 10.

title: Switch Lamps
core_prompt: Three switches downstairs control three lamps upstairs. You can go upstairs once. How find which switch controls which lamp?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: What if bulbs are LED and cool quickly?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Generalize strategy for 4 lamps with one trip.

hint_ladder: Turn one on long, one on short, one off.
solution_steps: Turn A on for a while then off, turn B on, leave C off.
Upstairs: lit=B, warm= A, cold dark= C.

title: Consecutive Cubes
core_prompt: Show that (n+1)^3 - n^3 is always odd when n is even.

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: What parity when n is odd?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Generalize parity of consecutive cube differences.

solution_steps: n(n+1) is even, so 3n(n+1) even; even+1 is odd.
